roiCalculator.title: ROI Calculator
roiCalculator.description: Calculate ad spend vs revenue with explanations
roiCalculator.messageGreat: Amazing! Your ad performance is excellent!
roiCalculator.messageGood: Great! Your ads are performing well!
roiCalculator.messageOk: Not bad! A little optimization would help.
roiCalculator.messageEven: Breaking even. Shall we improve the ads?
roiCalculator.messageLoss: You're losing money... Try changing the target or ad content.
roiCalculator.tip: Generally, ROAS above 300% is considered good. It varies by industry, but aim for 200%+ to start!

aiConnect.description: Connect your AI assistant to unlock ad copywriting, image generation, and more!
aiConnect.helpLink: Where do I get a key?
aiConnect.guide: You can get a free API key from Google AI Studio. Click the "Get API Key" button. Your key is stored only on your device and is not visible to anyone else.
aiConnect.connectedHint: You can now use all AI features
aiConnect.skipHint: You can still learn basics without an API key
aiConnect.errorInvalid: Please check your key. The API key is invalid.
aiConnect.errorQuota: API quota exceeded. Please try again later.
aiConnect.errorGeneral: Connection failed. Please check your key or try again later.

tips.title: App Tips
tips.tip1: Most apps support Korean, English, and Chinese. You can change the language in settings.
tips.tip2: One Kakao account lets you access multiple Kakao services (KakaoTalk, KakaoMap, Kakao T).
tips.tip3: If your foreign card doesn't work, register it with KakaoPay or NaverPay for payments.

aiSetup.title: Enrollment Setup
aiSetup.subtitle: Connect your AI assistant before entering the school

intro.title: What marketing job is right for you?
intro.subtitle: Discover your marketing DNA with 15 questions

loading.step3: Found the perfect job for you!

CEO.name: Big Picture Person
CEO.title: Brand Marketing
CEO.desc:
You are someone who draws the big picture.
You can see how the world is changing.
You always think about "Where should our brand go?"
You discover opportunities that others miss.
You are great at setting direction for your team.
Brand marketing is the perfect fit for you.
You create the image and values of a company.
You plan things like ads, logos, and slogans.
You make people feel "This brand is great!"
You are a marketer who grows brands with big dreams.

PM.name: Storyteller
PM.title: Content Marketing
PM.desc:
You are someone who creates stories.
Your head is full of fun ideas.
You imagine "What if I make this? People would love it!"
You enjoy sharing stories through writing, photos, and videos.
You create content that moves people's hearts.
Content marketing is the perfect fit for you.
You plan content for blogs, SNS, and YouTube.
You tell brand stories in an interesting way.
You read trends quickly and try new things.
You are a marketer who makes brands shine with creativity.

CPO.name: Numbers Person
CPO.title: Performance Marketing
CPO.desc:
You are someone who speaks with numbers.
You always check "How effective was it?"
When you see data, you instantly know what the problem is.
You make decisions based on numbers, not feelings.
You analyze ad results and find better methods.
Performance marketing is the perfect fit for you.
You calculate how much revenue each ad dollar brings.
You check clicks, conversion rates, and other numbers daily.
You advertise efficiently without wasting money.
You are a smart marketer who proves results with data.

CMO.name: People Gatherer
CMO.title: CRM Marketing
CMO.desc:
You are someone who gathers people.
You understand how others feel very well.
You are great at figuring out "What does this person like?"
You have a talent for making customers come back again.
You value relationships between people.
CRM marketing is the perfect fit for you.
You send personalized messages to customers.
You plan things like membership levels, points, and coupons.
You make customers feel "This place is the best!"
You are a marketer who grows brands by building relationships.

CSL.name: Sales Person
CSL.title: Live Commerce
CSL.desc:
You are someone who sells things.
You enjoy talking in front of people.
When you explain "Why this product is great," everyone wants to buy it.
When customers hesitate, you say just the right words to persuade them.
When you set a goal, you follow through to the end.
Live commerce is the perfect fit for you.
You introduce and sell products in front of a camera.
You sell things while chatting with customers in real time.
Saying "If you don't buy now, you'll regret it!" comes naturally to you.
You are a marketer who creates sales through action.

Q1.situation: A competitor launched a cheaper product! Your reaction?
Q1.A: Price wars lead to failure. Let's differentiate on quality.
Q1.B: Analyze costs right away to see if we can lower our price too.

Q3.situation: Your role in a team project?
Q3.A: Set the overall direction and assign roles.

Q4.situation: Not enough budget for a new product launch!
Q4.A: Create buzz through SNS viral marketing.
Q4.B: Directly sell to a small group of customers.

Q5.situation: First thing you do at a marketing meeting?

Q6.A: Analyze the root cause with data.
Q6.B: Call them directly and sincerely apologize.

Q8.situation: You found a new business idea!
Q8.A: Research market size and growth rate first.

Q10.situation: You got 1 million won for ads!

Q12.B: Focus on numerical goals and KPIs.

Q13.situation: Secret to winning a competitive pitch?

Q14.situation: Your goal as a marketer in 1 year?

Q15.situation: Why would a team pick you?

Q1.situation: A friend asks you to recommend a restaurant!
Q1.A: Analyze blog reviews, ratings, and visitor counts to pick one.
Q1.B: Recommend a place with great atmosphere that I've been to.

Q2.situation: Your club is running a booth at the school festival!
Q2.A: Survey what menu items sell best first.
Q2.B: Plan a visually stunning menu that would go viral on SNS.

Q3.A: Follow the recipe exactly step by step.
Q3.B: Mix ingredients by feeling and create something original.

Q4.A: Research YouTube videos and reviews thoroughly before starting.
Q4.B: Just start and learn as I go.

Q5.A: Prepare a logical presentation with data and charts.
Q5.B: Build a story that moves the audience's hearts.

Q6.A: Set a budget and systematically plan the venue, food, and gifts.
Q6.B: Create a surprise event and a touching video letter.

Q7.situation: Your favorite cafe is losing customers!
Q7.A: Compare prices and menus with nearby cafes.
Q7.B: Suggest SNS marketing ideas to the cafe owner.

Q8.A: Research similar items' prices to set a fair price.
Q8.B: Take nice photos and write an attractive description.

Q9.situation: You're in charge of promoting a school club!
Q9.A: Analyze last year's signup data to define the target.
Q9.B: Create fun memes and challenges to attract attention.

Q10.A: Carefully compare review counts, ratings, and reorder rates.
Q10.B: Choose a place with tasty-looking photos and appealing descriptions.

Q11.situation: Your convenience store wants to boost sales!
Q11.A: Analyze sales data by time slot and place popular items up front.
Q11.B: Talk to customers directly and recommend products.

Q12.A: Analyze popular keywords and choose search-friendly topics.
Q12.B: Create unique content about topics I truly love.

Q13.situation: Adding a new menu to the school cafeteria?
Q13.B: Immediately introduce whatever's trending on SNS.

Q14.situation: A new store opened in your neighborhood!
Q14.A: Check how many similar stores exist and assess competition.
Q14.B: Create an Instagram account and plan an opening event.

Q15.situation: A friend suggests selling homemade cookies!
Q15.A: Calculate ingredient costs, packaging, and break-even point first.
Q15.B: Design pretty packaging and a brand name first.

Q1.situation: Your company asks you to plan a welcome party for new hires!
Q1.A: Check the budget and headcount, then pick an efficient venue.
Q1.B: Prepare a surprise event that will touch the new employees.

Q2.situation: First thing you do when you get paid?
Q2.A: Organize income and expenses in a spreadsheet and plan savings.
Q2.B: Buy things I've been wanting and enjoy a nice meal.

Q3.situation: Choosing an anniversary gift for your partner?
Q3.A: Buy something practical based on what they've shown interest in.
Q3.B: Write a letter by hand and gift a special experience.

Q4.situation: You've become the leader of a new project at work!
Q4.A: Set the project timeline and KPIs first.
Q4.B: Identify team members' strengths and motivate them.

Q5.situation: You want to earn money with a side job!
Q5.A: Research which side jobs have the best hourly returns.
Q5.B: Create content using skills I'm good at.

Q6.A: Organize the situation objectively and explain logically.
Q6.B: Meet in person and have a heartfelt conversation.

Q7.situation: If you were opening a store, what would you do first?
Q7.A: Analyze the commercial area and foot traffic.
Q7.B: Decide on the store interior and brand concept.

Q8.A: Carefully analyze financial statements and market data.
Q8.B: Boldly invest in areas that feel like they have growth potential.

Q9.situation: A colleague complains about their work!
Q9.A: Analyze process problems and suggest improvements.
Q9.B: Show empathy first and find solutions together.

Q10.situation: Your social media posts aren't getting views!
Q10.A: Analyze insight data to find optimal posting times and hashtags.
Q10.B: Create more emotional and relatable content.

Q11.situation: You need to negotiate your salary at work!
Q11.A: Prepare industry average salary data and my performance records.
Q11.B: Sincerely express my contributions and passion.

Q12.situation: A friend brings a startup idea!
Q12.A: Ask about market size, competitors, and revenue model.
Q12.B: Suggest fun additional ideas to develop the concept.

Q13.situation: Your company wants to improve customer satisfaction!
Q13.A: Analyze customer review data to find complaint patterns.
Q13.B: Send a personal thank-you message to each customer.

Q14.A: Create a comparison chart of salary, benefits, and growth potential.
Q14.B: First think about what I really want to do.

Q15.situation: Your team didn't meet the sales target!
Q15.A: Analyze data to identify where drop-offs occurred.
Q15.B: Boost team morale and discuss new strategies together.

graduationProject.cardReady: All classes completed! Check your graduation project
graduationProject.description: Combine everything you learned in periods 1-6 to create your brand plan!
graduationProject.offlineNote: Write it by hand on a large poster board
graduationProject.presentNote: Present it to your classmates when done

section1.title: My Marketer Type
section1.guide: Write your aptitude test result on the plan

section2.title: Market Analysis
section2.guide: Summarize competitors and customer pain points

section3.title: Brand Strategy
section3.guide: Write your USP, brand name, and slogan

section4.title: Content Strategy
section4.guide: Attach your card news copy to the plan

section5.title: Sales Strategy
section5.guide: Write your product page or live commerce plan

graduationProject.tip1: Write in large letters for easy reading
graduationProject.tip2: Use colored pens to highlight key points
graduationProject.tip4: Speak with confidence during your presentation

naverMap.name: Naver Map
naverMap.description: The most accurate Korean map. Public transit, walking, and driving directions with real-time traffic.

kakaomap.name: KakaoMap
kakaomap.description: Map app integrated with Kakao. Easily call a taxi with Kakao Taxi integration.

kakaoT.name: Kakao T
kakaoT.description: Taxi, designated driver, parking, bike - all in one app. Essential for taxi rides in Korea!

subwayKorea.name: Subway Korea
subwayKorea.description: Nationwide subway map and real-time arrival info. Supports English, Chinese, Japanese.

papago.name: Papago
papago.description: Naver's AI translation app. Text, voice, image, and conversation translation all supported.

naverDictionary.name: Naver Dictionary
naverDictionary.description: Essential for learning Korean! Comprehensive dictionary with definitions, examples, and pronunciation.

coupangEats.name: Coupang Eats
coupangEats.description: Single-person delivery specialist! Fast delivery and various restaurants. English supported.

shuttleDelivery.name: Shuttle Delivery
shuttleDelivery.description: Delivery app for foreigners. Order in English and pay with foreign cards.

coupang.name: Coupang
coupang.description: Korea's largest shopping mall famous for Rocket Delivery. Dawn and same-day delivery available.

karrot.name: Karrot
karrot.description: Neighborhood-based secondhand trading app. Buy and sell safely with local neighbors.

creatrip.name: Creatrip
creatrip.description: Korea travel info for foreign tourists. Discount coupons and reservation services.

waug.name: Waug
waug.description: Book Korean activities, tours, and tickets. Various experiences made easy.

emergencyReady.name: Emergency Ready
emergencyReady.description: Official government disaster alert app. Emergency info on earthquakes, typhoons, air quality.

xeCurrency.name: XE Currency
xeCurrency.description: Real-time exchange rates. Useful global currency app for converting to Korean Won.

setup.title: Essential App Setup
setup.description: Naver account, email, and map basics

goals.0: Create a Naver account and log in
goals.2: Know the Korean names for common symbols
goals.3: Search for places and get directions on Naver Map

naverAccount.title: Create a Naver Account
naverAccount.description: The starting point for life in Korea! With a Naver account, you can use email, maps, shopping, and many other services.

substeps.0: Search for 'Naver' in the app store and install it
substeps.1: Open the app and tap 'Sign Up' at the bottom
substeps.2: Enter your phone number and receive a verification code
substeps.3: Create an ID and password (at least 8 characters with letters and numbers)
substeps.4: Sign up complete! Log into the Naver app

email.title: Using Naver Email
email.description: Email is essential for sending and receiving official documents. Learn how to send emails using Naver Mail.

substeps.0: Naver app ‚Üí top-left menu (‚â°) ‚Üí tap 'Mail'
substeps.1: Tap the 'Compose' button to write a new email
substeps.2: Enter recipient address, subject, and message

symbols.title: Korean Names for Common Symbols
symbols.description: Knowing the Korean names for symbols used in email addresses and websites is very useful.

substeps.0: @ ‚Üí Í≥®Î±ÖÏù¥ (gol-baeng-i) - 'snail'
substeps.1: . ‚Üí Ï©ú / Ï†ê (jjeom / jeom) - 'dot'
substeps.2: - ‚Üí Îã§Ïãú / ÎπºÍ∏∞ (da-si / ppae-gi) - 'dash/minus'

naverMap.title: Using Naver Map
naverMap.description: Naver Map is the most accurate map app in Korea. Learn how to search places, get directions, and bookmark favorites.

substeps.0: Install 'Naver Map' from the app store
substeps.1: Type where you want to go in the search bar (e.g., nearest convenience store)
substeps.2: Use the 'Directions' button to check transit/walking routes
substeps.3: Tap the ‚òÜ star icon to bookmark your frequently visited places

tips.0: Use at least 8 characters with letters, numbers, and special characters for a secure password
tips.1: Choose your Naver ID carefully ‚Äî it cannot be changed once created
tips.2: Tap 'Nearby' on Naver Map to easily find convenience stores, pharmacies, and more

checklist.0: Log in to your Naver account
checklist.1: Send a test email to the person next to you
checklist.2: Search for our classroom location on Naver Map

kakao.title: Kakao Certificate & Kiosk
kakao.description: Certificate issuance, card registration, kiosk practice

goals.2: Understand the importance of identity verification
goals.3: Order and pay using a kiosk

preparation.2: Debit or credit card registered under your name

certificate.title: Issue a Kakao Certificate
certificate.description: A Kakao Certificate is a digital ID used for logging into government sites, banking, and more.

substeps.0: KakaoTalk ‚Üí tap the 'More (¬∑¬∑¬∑)' tab at the bottom
substeps.1: Find and tap 'Certificate' or 'Wallet'
substeps.2: Select 'Issue Certificate'
substeps.3: Enter your name, date of birth, and phone number
substeps.4: After identity verification, set a 6-digit password

kakaoPay.title: Register Card on KakaoPay
kakaoPay.description: Registering a card on KakaoPay lets you easily send money and make payments.

substeps.0: KakaoTalk ‚Üí 'More' ‚Üí tap 'KakaoPay'
substeps.1: Select 'Register Card' or 'Add Payment Method'
substeps.2: Enter your card number, expiry date, and CVC
substeps.3: Complete identity verification and you're done!

identity.title: Why Identity Verification Matters
identity.description: In Korea, having things registered under your own name is very important. Using a phone or card under someone else's name can restrict your access to services.

substeps.0: Always register your phone under your own name ‚Äî certificates, banking, and government services all require a phone under your name
substeps.1: Using a phone under someone else's name means you can't verify your identity, blocking most services
substeps.2: Bank accounts and cards must also be under your own name

kioskIntro.title: Kiosk Basics
kioskIntro.description: A kiosk is a touchscreen machine at cafes, restaurants, and theaters that lets you order without talking to staff.

substeps.0: What is a kiosk? ‚Üí A self-service touchscreen machine for ordering and paying
substeps.1: Basic flow: Select menu ‚Üí Choose options ‚Üí Review cart ‚Üí Dine-in/Takeout ‚Üí Pay ‚Üí Done
substeps.2: Payment methods: Card payment (most common), easy pay (KakaoPay, NaverPay, etc.), cash
substeps.4: If you get confused, press 'Home' to start over!

tips.0: Remember your Kakao Certificate password! You'll need to reissue it if you forget
tips.1: If the kiosk is confusing, it's okay to ask staff for help by saying 'ÎèÑÏôÄÏ£ºÏÑ∏Ïöî' (do-wa-ju-se-yo)
tips.2: Paying with KakaoPay may give you discounts or points

kiosk.title: Cafe Kiosk Order Practice
kiosk.description: Practice ordering at a cafe kiosk using the simulator!

checklist.0: Order one drink on the kiosk simulator
checklist.1: Try selecting options (extra shot, syrup, etc.)

goals.1: Understand common terms used on Gov24
goals.2: Search for and issue official documents
goals.3: Save issued documents as PDF and send by email

preparation.0: Smartphone under your name (with Kakao Certificate issued)

register.title: Register on Gov24
register.description: Gov24 is Korea's official government service portal. Foreigners can also register and issue documents.

substeps.0: Install the 'Gov24' app from the app store
substeps.1: 'Sign Up' ‚Üí Select 'Foreigner'
substeps.2: Enter your Alien Registration Number, name, and phone number
substeps.3: Verify your identity with Kakao Certificate and complete registration!

terms.title: Gov24 Glossary
terms.description: Knowing common Korean terms used on Gov24 will make document issuance much easier.

substeps.0: Ï≤¥Î•òÏßÄ (che-ryu-ji) ‚Üí Current residential address
substeps.1: ÎèôÍ±∞Í∞ÄÏ°± (dong-geo-ga-jok) ‚Üí Family members living together
substeps.2: ÏÑ∏ÎåÄÏ£º (se-dae-ju) ‚Üí Head of household (usually the oldest person)
substeps.3: ÎØºÏõê (min-won) ‚Üí Government service request or document
substeps.4: Î∞úÍ∏â (bal-geup) ‚Üí Issuance / getting a document issued
substeps.5: Ïô∏Íµ≠Ïù∏Îì±Î°ù ÏÇ¨Ïã§Ï¶ùÎ™Ö ‚Üí Certificate proving you are a registered foreigner in Korea

search.title: Search & Issue Documents
search.description: Learn how to search for and issue documents on Gov24.

substeps.0: Gov24 app ‚Üí type the document name in the search bar (e.g., 'Alien Registration Certificate')
substeps.1: Select the document you want from the search results
substeps.2: Fill in the required info and tap 'Apply'
substeps.3: Done! Check your document in 'My Services' ‚Üí 'Issued Documents'

pdf.title: Save Documents as PDF
pdf.description: Save issued documents as PDF files so you can access them later.

substeps.0: Open the document in your Issued Documents and tap 'Download' or 'Save'
substeps.1: Choose a save location (My Files ‚Üí Downloads folder recommended)
substeps.2: You can find saved files in the 'My Files' app

emailSend.title: Send Documents by Email
emailSend.description: Send issued documents via email to submit them to companies, schools, etc.

substeps.0: In Naver Mail, select 'Compose'
substeps.1: Tap the üìé clip icon to attach the PDF file
substeps.2: Enter the recipient address and subject, then send

tips.0: The Alien Registration Certificate is the most basic document needed for bank accounts, phone contracts, and more
tips.1: Most document issuances are free. If there's a fee, it will be shown in advance
tips.2: Always save issued documents as PDF. You may need them again later

certificate.title: Alien Registration Certificate Practice
certificate.description: Actually issue a document on Gov24!

checklist.0: Log in to the Gov24 app
checklist.2: Issue the document and save it as PDF
checklist.3: Send the saved PDF by email

translation.title: Translation Apps & Digital Safety
translation.description: ChatGPT, Papago, Google Translate, security settings

goals.0: Translate images (medicine packets, notices, etc.) with ChatGPT
goals.1: Use Papago's text, voice, and image translation
goals.2: Use Google Translate's live camera translation
goals.3: Compare the pros and cons of the three translation apps

preparation.0: ChatGPT, Papago, and Google Translate apps installed
preparation.1: Korean text to translate (notices, menus, etc.)

chatgpt.title: ChatGPT Image Translation
chatgpt.description: ChatGPT can read and translate photos you upload. Great for translating medicine packets, contracts, and notices.

substeps.0: Open the ChatGPT app and log in
substeps.1: In the chat, tap the üìé (clip) or üì∑ (camera) icon
substeps.2: Take a photo of the Korean document or select from gallery
substeps.3: Type 'Translate this to [your language]' and send

papago.title: Using Papago Translation
papago.description: Papago is Naver's translation app. It offers the most natural and accurate Korean translations.

substeps.0: Text translation: Type or paste the content to translate
substeps.1: Voice translation: Tap the üé§ mic button and speak for instant translation
substeps.2: Image translation: Tap the üì∑ camera button to take a photo and it will recognize and translate text
substeps.3: Conversation translation: Two people take turns speaking for real-time interpretation

googleTranslate.title: Using Google Translate
googleTranslate.description: Google Translate supports over 100 languages, including languages not available on Papago (Nepali, Myanmar, etc.).

substeps.0: Text translation: Type the content in the input box
substeps.1: Camera translation: Tap üì∑ and point your camera at signs or menus for real-time translation
substeps.2: Voice translation: Tap üé§ and speak for translation
substeps.3: Offline translation: Download language files in advance to translate without internet

comparison.title: Translation App Comparison
comparison.description: Each of the three translation apps has different strengths. Use the right app for each situation.

substeps.0: ChatGPT ‚Üí Pros: Best context understanding, great for documents/contracts | Cons: Requires internet, limited free use
substeps.1: Papago ‚Üí Pros: Most natural Korean translation, conversation translation | Cons: Fewer languages (about 15)
substeps.2: Google Translate ‚Üí Pros: 100+ languages, live camera translation | Cons: Korean translation less natural than Papago

kakaoGpt.title: Using GPT in KakaoTalk
kakaoGpt.description: You can ask GPT questions and request translations directly within KakaoTalk.

substeps.0: Search for 'ChatGPT' or 'AskUp' channel in KakaoTalk and add it
substeps.1: Send the content you want translated in the channel chat
substeps.2: Example: 'Translate this Korean to English: Ïò§Îäò ÌöåÏùòÎäî 3ÏãúÏóê ÏãúÏûëÌï©ÎãàÎã§'

permissions.title: Managing App Permissions
permissions.description: Learn how to manage what information (location, photos, contacts, etc.) apps can access.

substeps.0: Settings ‚Üí Apps ‚Üí Select an app ‚Üí check 'Permissions'
substeps.1: Deny unnecessary permissions (e.g., a game accessing your contacts)
substeps.2: For location permission, 'Allow only while using the app' is recommended
substeps.3: Denying permissions still allows most basic app functions

spam.title: Spam Message Blocking
spam.description: Korea has a lot of advertising and phishing messages. Learn how to block spam.

substeps.0: Messages app ‚Üí Settings (‚öôÔ∏è) ‚Üí Turn on 'Spam Blocking' or 'Message Filtering'
substeps.1: Never tap links in messages from unknown numbers!
substeps.2: Messages starting with '[WebÎ∞úÏã†]' that claim to be from banks or delivery services are 99% scams

tips.0: For medicine packets and hospital documents, ChatGPT photo translation is most accurate
tips.1: Use Papago for everyday conversations, Google Translate for rare languages
tips.2: Never click links from unknown numbers! Especially messages about 'delivery confirmation' or 'fine payment' are scams
tips.3: Be cautious if an app requests too many permissions during installation

translate.title: Translation Practice & Security Check
translate.description: Use translation apps and check your security settings!

checklist.0: Use ChatGPT to translate a photo of a Korean notice
checklist.1: Translate the same content with Papago and compare results
checklist.2: Try Google Translate's camera translation feature
checklist.3: Check your smartphone's app permission settings
checklist.4: Turn on spam blocking in your Messages app

kiosk.title: Kiosk Practice
kiosk.subtitle: Order drinks at a cafe
kiosk.description: Practice ordering and paying on a screen that looks just like a real cafe kiosk.
kiosk.whatIsKioskDesc: A kiosk is a self-service touchscreen machine found at cafes, restaurants, theaters, and more. In Korea, they're in almost every store.

learn.touchScreen: Start ordering by touching the screen

kiosk.practiceNote: Practice on a screen similar to a real cafe

helper.welcome: Touch the screen to start ordering!
helper.options: Select your options and tap 'Add to Cart'!
helper.payment: Choose a payment method! Card is most common.
helper.card: In real life, you'd insert a card. Here, tap 'Approve'!
helper.receipt: Many people choose 'No Print' for the environment!
helper.complete: Congratulations! You completed the kiosk order!

cardPayment.title: Card Payment (Easy Pay)
cardPayment.insertGuide: Please insert your credit/debit card as shown below.

points.ask: Would you like to earn points?

receipt.ask: Would you like to print the receipt?

complete.message: You can now confidently order at a real cafe!
